text: Generative AI has definitely been a big
part of the tech buzz.

We're still seeing companies
stress testing the technology

to see what it can bring
to their organization.
With that LLMs prove time

and time again that they
cannot be the one sole

and standalone solution
for organizational use cases,
especially not for enterprises,
because they need guarantees.
They need to address the risks around it.

And these are things that
go beyond the capabilities

of LLMs, and that's where
AI21 gets into the picture.
We're building foundation models

and AI systems that address
those enterprise workflows.

AI21's models are purposely
built for the enterprise.
If you look at Jamba,

it's the first ever SSM
transformer model out there,

and it was crafted to
deliver high-end results,
which makes it really good

for high scale use cases
in the organization
that can run in a cost effective way.

Collaborating with Amazon
Bedrock enables enterprises
to securely access and deploy AI21's

generative AI
model, equipping customers
with both the technology
and the environment they need
to scale powerful GenAI workflows.

Together the focus is on
data privacy, scalability,

and user accessibility,
allowing businesses to innovate

and efficiently bring AI driven
application to production.

For AWS customers, Bedrock
is the obvious choice.

As all their data already
resides on AWS, it's so easy

for them to get started
with Jamba on Bedrock.
